title: Lumbar spine MRI â€” conservative care threshold (demo paraphrase)
text: Advanced imaging of the lumbar spine is typically considered when symptoms persist despite a course of provider-directed conservative care (often about 6 weeks) and findings suggest radiculopathy or other concerning features. If conservative care is not documented, additional information may be required.

title: Red flags / urgent indications (demo paraphrase)
text: Conservative care requirements may not apply when there are red-flag indications suggesting serious pathology (e.g., suspected cauda equina syndrome, progressive neurologic deficit, malignancy, infection, or significant trauma).

title: Documentation expectation (demo paraphrase)
text: Requests should include relevant clinical documentation supporting medical necessity: symptom duration, prior therapies tried and duration, pertinent exam findings, and any prior imaging/tests when applicable.
